content: these fingerless gloves with a basic design will allow you to practice your skills with color work photo sequence on instagram 1 **pattern notes** knitted from bottom to top after 2 5cm / 1in of 1x1 rib the body is worked following the leaf chart instructions the thumb stitches are worked from his own chart while continue with the leaf chart in the rest of the stitches then finish with 2 5cm / 1in of 1x1 rib for the hand and 1 5cm / ½in of 1x1 rib for the thumb **know-how** -work with two colors at the same time -read colorwork chart -make one left and make one right increases **yarn** fingering weight yarn about 50 grams in total in two colors for the sample i used garnstudio drops fabel 75% wool / 25 % polyamide 50g / 205m per ball in color 100 natural main color and color 542 green contrasting color i spent about 20 grams on each color **needles and notions** -3mm / u s 2½ needle s of your preferred type for working small circumferences -3 stitch markers 3 more if you want separate the repetitions of the chart -waste yarn for hold thumb stitches -tapestry needle -scissors **gauge** 33 sts and 32 rounds to 10cm / 4in over colorwork pattern in the round use 3mm / u s 2½ needle s as a starting point for swatching **size** to fit average adult hand with 18-20cm / 7-8in circumference **measurements** length from bottom to top 24cm / 9½in circumference of the palm 17 5cm / 7in length from bottom to the thumb 11cm / 4½in length of thumb 7cm / 2½in length from the end of the thumb to the top 8cm / 3in 1 https //www instagram com/p/cnxbn6joygk/ igshid=1fz75ycqyl4u1
